instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.5V_S4: What is 5V_S4? This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4”.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
The board is missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is 0.064v i also notice that when the board is connected to a power supply it goes from 270amps then goes down to 60amps.

where should I begin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
yes when connected to my benchtop power supply amperage is high then goes down seems like odd behavior not sure if that may be a clue to what could be wrong. it does look like the board has been worked on before seems like isl was replaced and a trace  near the smc was blown re attached it. still nothing.

wondering if it could be smc related seeing how theres been damage around there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: With 270 Amps you can weld an inch thick steel. Please get your units right

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Board history? Is it power cycling on <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL> is present but not power cycling. it looks like it may have been water damaged before due to slight corrosion on test pads.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: In the first post you said it was missing! What is it now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: sorry <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> is missing and not power cycling. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_IPD</SIGNAL> is present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Crap under SMC is suspect. Checked PPVRTC too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
